stories.title: TUI Application Framework
stories.description: As a developer, I need a core TUI application framework using a Go terminal UI library (like bubbletea) that handles screen management, keyboard input, and component lifecycle so that all other features can be built on a solid foundation.
acceptanceCriteria: Application starts and displays a responsive TUI interface
Keyboard input is captured and processed correctly
Screen resizes are handled gracefully
Application can be quit cleanly with 'q' or Ctrl+C
Basic navigation between views/screens works
Configuration file support for server URL and settings
Error states are displayed clearly to the user

stories.title: User Authentication and Session Management
stories.description: As a user, I want to log in to the webby server from the terminal so that I can access my personal ebook library. This includes login, registration, and token management with automatic refresh before expiry.
acceptanceCriteria: User can log in with username and password
User can register a new account
JWT token is stored securely in local config
Token is automatically refreshed before expiry
User can log out and clear session
Invalid credentials show appropriate error message
Connection errors are handled gracefully

stories.title: Browse and Select Ebooks
stories.description: As a user, I want to browse my ebook library with sorting, filtering, and search capabilities so that I can find and select a book to read. This includes viewing books by title, author, or series, with pagination support.
acceptanceCriteria: Books are displayed in a scrollable list
List shows title, author, and series information
User can sort by title, author, series, or upload date
User can search books by title or author
Pagination works for large libraries
User can select a book to read
Books can be viewed grouped by author or series

stories.title: Read Ebooks with Vim-like Navigation
stories.description: As a user, I want to read ebooks in the terminal with vim-like keybindings (j/k for scroll, h/l or n/p for next/prev page, g/G for top/bottom, q to quit) so that I can navigate content efficiently. The reader should display plain text content with proper word wrapping.
acceptanceCriteria: j/k keys scroll content up/down
h/l or n/p navigate between chapters
g jumps to top, G jumps to bottom
q quits reader and returns to library
Text wraps correctly to terminal width
Chapter title is displayed in header
Current position indicator shows progress
Page up/down keys work for larger scrolls

stories.title: Favorites/Starred Books
stories.description: Allow users to mark books as favorites with a star. Add ability to filter library to show only favorited books. Favorites should persist across sessions.

stories.title: Reading Queue (Want to Read)
stories.description: Add a "Want to Read" queue where users can add books they plan to read. Queue should be orderable and viewable as a filtered list in the library.

stories.title: Filter by Author/Series
stories.description: Add quick filter shortcuts to show only books by a specific author or in a specific series. When a book is selected, allow jumping to "more by this author" or "more in this series".

stories.title: Delete Books from Library
stories.description: Allow users to delete books from the library via the TUI. Include confirmation prompt before deletion to prevent accidents.

stories.title: Book Details View
stories.description: Add a detailed book view showing full metadata: title, author, series, description, publisher, ISBN, file size, upload date, and reading progress. Accessible by pressing a key on a selected book.

stories.title: Cover Thumbnails in Library
stories.description: Display book cover thumbnails next to titles in the library view for terminals that support inline images (Kitty, iTerm2, Sixel). Fall back to text-only for unsupported terminals.

stories.title: Search Within Book
stories.description: Add text search functionality within the current book (epub/pdf). Show search results with context and allow jumping to matches. Support forward/backward navigation between matches.

stories.title: Bookmarks
stories.description: Allow users to save bookmarks at specific locations within a book. Show bookmark list and allow jumping to saved positions. Bookmarks should persist and sync with server.

stories.title: Font Size Adjustment
stories.description: Add ability to increase/decrease text size in the reader with +/- keys. Font size preference should persist in config. Affects text wrapping and lines per page.

stories.title: Visual Progress Bar in Reader
stories.description: Add a visual progress bar in the reader footer showing position within current chapter and overall book progress. Use Unicode block characters for smooth rendering.

stories.title: Chapter Progress Display
stories.description: Show detailed progress within current chapter: "Page X of Y" or percentage. Display in reader header alongside chapter title.

stories.title: Continuous Scroll Mode
stories.description: Add alternative reading mode with continuous scrolling instead of page-by-page navigation. Toggle between modes with a key. Useful for longer reading sessions.

stories.title: Comic Zoom/Pan
stories.description: Add zoom and pan functionality to comic viewer. Allow zooming in with z/+ and out with Z/-. Support panning with arrow keys when zoomed. Reset zoom with 0 key.

stories.title: Comic Dual Page View
stories.description: Add side-by-side two-page spread mode for comics. Toggle between single and dual page view with d key. Handle odd page counts gracefully.

stories.title: Comic Fit Mode Toggle
stories.description: Add toggle between fit-width, fit-height, and fit-screen modes for comic pages. Cycle with f key. Remember preference per comic or globally in config.

stories.title: Themes/Color Schemes
stories.description: Add support for multiple color themes: dark (default), light, solarized, nord, etc. Theme selection in config and via TUI settings. Custom theme support via JSON.

stories.title: Custom Keybindings
stories.description: Allow users to customize keyboard shortcuts via JSON config. Support remapping all navigation, reader, and library keys. Provide sensible defaults and validation.

stories.title: Settings TUI Menu
stories.description: Add in-app settings menu accessible with S key from library. Allow configuring theme, font size, keybindings preview, and server URL. Changes persist to JSON config file.
